review_blob: Leads Belgian but finishes with what I might characterize as an astringent quality. I found carbonation too fine and intense. Overall mouthfeel subtracted from what clearly are sophisticated flavors. I appreciate Maudite, but wouldnt put it on any shortlist.

Excellent via cask at the linkery. Far and away the best stout I have ever had. The only component that was not flawless was the aroma which didnt suck me in. Much better via cask. come to san diego and try it the way it was supposed to be!

My favorite beer of all time (not including my homebrew of course). Available via cask (at least the night i was there) at the linkery in san diego. Entire table agreed that this was heaven on earth. cask moderated some of the intensity and added a smoother more robust finish lacking in some san diego ipas. The grapefruit intensity of the hops was mellowed by the cask and was delightful to smell in a balloon wine glass.
If every brewery made a stout as rich, deep, and unique, life would be even better. While not my favorite stout, and not the best example of an imperial, this beer is pleasing and rich.

Not your average stout...but the coffee effect is a little overdone. By that I mean the taste of coffee covers up some of the beerness. Smooth drinking and fairly aromatic but feels like candy not beer.
